name: Khelcom Farm
description: A Black-owned urban farm focusing on diversified vegetables, cut flowers, and herbs. They also sell Senegalese baskets, eggs, and maple syrup. Their farm stand is open from mid-May through October
services: Black-owned Garden education in Vermont consultation

name: Clemmons Family Farm
address: Charlotte, VT (Specific street address not readily available, but it is a landmark on Vermont's African-American Heritage Trail)
description: One of the largest and oldest African-American-owned historic farms in Vermont. It is transitioning into a non-profit organization focused on preserving the farm, empowering Black artists and culture bearers, and building a multicultural community around African American/African diaspora history, arts, and culture. They offer programs related to farming, arts, and cultural heritage
services: Black-owned Garden education in Vermont consultation

name: Black Dirt Farm
address: Northeast Kingdom, VT (Specific address not provided)
description: A diversified family farm in Vermont's Northeast Kingdom that practices regenerative agriculture. They collect food scraps for composting, raise hens, and produce compost, worm castings, pasture-raised eggs, meat birds, and seasonal crops. They also offer compost collection services
services: Black-owned Garden education in Vermont consultation
